channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MJAVADOC-338] When includeDependencySources=true the javadoc plugin should not download the internet every time it is run
item.project: Maven Javadoc Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description:
This is my configuration:

      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <phase>package</phase>
            <goals>
              <goal>javadoc</goal>
            </goals>
          </execution>
        </executions>
        <configuration>
          <includeDependencySources>true</includeDependencySources>
          <includeTransitiveDependencySources>true</includeTransitiveDependencySources>
          <dependencySourceIncludes>
            <dependencySourceInclude>org.drools:*</dependencySourceInclude>
          </dependencySourceIncludes>
        </configuration>
      </plugin>

the javadoc plugins downloads a very long list of dependencies every time it is run:

gdesmet@gdesmetRedHat2010 droolsjbpm-uber-distribution [master *] $ mvn javadoc:javadoc
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
[INFO]                                                                         
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Building Drools and jBPM uber distribution 5.4.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] 
[INFO] >>> maven-javadoc-plugin:2.8:javadoc (default-cli) @ droolsjbpm-uber-distribution >>>
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- maven-enforcer-plugin:1.0:enforce (default) @ droolsjbpm-uber-distribution ---
[INFO] 
[INFO] <<< maven-javadoc-plugin:2.8:javadoc (default-cli) @ droolsjbpm-uber-distribution <<<
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- maven-javadoc-plugin:2.8:javadoc (default-cli) @ droolsjbpm-uber-distribution ---

item.summary: When includeDependencySources=true the javadoc plugin should not download the internet every time it is run

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Notice how it always looks for "javadoc-resources" artifacts. But since I am not use those, I don't see the point.

I have the same comment as well. I'd like to use this feature but the build performance cost is high. In my case, I'm only using it to include 2 of my additional libraries but it still tries to access the javadoc-resources of every dependency of my project. At a minimum it should only look for those javadoc-resources that will be included.

Here's a portion of my build output for reference:

[INFO] --- maven-javadoc-plugin:2.9:javadoc (published-api) @ uma-imdesktop ---
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/net/sf/ehcache/sizeof-agent/1.0.1/sizeof-agent-1.0.1.pom
[WARNING] Missing POM for net.sf.ehcache:sizeof-agent:jar:1.0.1

[WARNING] Missing POM for com.ibm.websphere:uow:jar:6.0.2.17
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/stax/stax-ri/1.0/stax-ri-1.0.pom
[WARNING] Missing POM for stax:stax-ri:jar:1.0
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/org/slf4j/slf4j-api/1.6.1/slf4j-api-1.6.1-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/log4j/log4j/1.2.15/log4j-1.2.15-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/org/slf4j/slf4j-log4j12/1.6.1/slf4j-log4j12-1.6.1-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/com/fimt/asts/ws/frf-handlers/3.0.0/frf-handlers-3.0.0-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/com/fimt/asts/ws/frf-identity/3.0.0/frf-identity-3.0.0-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/com/fimt/asts/ws/frf-utils/3.0.0/frf-utils-3.0.0-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/com/fimt/asts/ws/config-ws-stubs/1.0.0/config-ws-stubs-1.0.0-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/com/fimt/asts/frf/maven-archetype-frf-contract-first/3.0.0/maven-archetype-frf-contract-first-3.0.0-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/org/springframework/spring-aop/3.2.1.RELEASE/spring-aop-3.2.1.RELEASE-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/aopalliance/aopalliance/1.0/aopalliance-1.0-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/org/springframework/spring-beans/3.2.1.RELEASE/spring-beans-3.2.1.RELEASE-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/org/springframework/spring-core/3.2.1.RELEASE/spring-core-3.2.1.RELEASE-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/org/codehaus/jackson/jackson-core-asl/1.9.4/jackson-core-asl-1.9.4-javadoc-resources.jar

Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/org/springframework/spring-context/3.2.1.RELEASE/spring-context-3.2.1.RELEASE-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/org/springframework/spring-expression/3.2.1.RELEASE/spring-expression-3.2.1.RELEASE-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/commons-collections/commons-collections/3.2.1/commons-collections-3.2.1-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/commons-lang/commons-lang/2.4/commons-lang-2.4-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/commons-httpclient/commons-httpclient/3.1/commons-httpclient-3.1-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/commons-codec/commons-codec/1.4/commons-codec-1.4-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/javax/transaction/jta/1.1/jta-1.1-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/javax/xml/bind/jaxb-api/2.2/jaxb-api-2.2-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/javax/xml/stream/stax-api/1.0-2/stax-api-1.0-2-javadoc-resources.jar
Downloading: http://fimt-nexus-repository.fmrco.com/nexus/content/groups/public/javax/activation/activation/1.1/activation-1.1-javadoc-resources.jar
I would say it has nothing to do with javadoc-resources.

It looks like it's doing what you asked it to do: trying to resolve javadoc-resources bundles for all transitive drools dependencies. I suppose you might be able to refine the configuration better if you had a set of includes/excludes configurations specific to javadoc-resources, particularly since these aren't all that common. But the log you posted is just a long list of 404's, right? So, they're probably coming back fairly quickly, and IIRC the 404 result should be stored in your local repository (unless you're using -U to bypass that result caching).

The specification of how dependencySourceInclude may then leave room for different expectations. My expectation was that the included sources would apply transitively. So who configures <dependencySourceInclude>org.drools:*</dependencySourceInclude> will only get org.drools dependencies, and not transitive dependencies, unless they're also in org.drools.

The use case I'm pursuing is the following: my.company:api-1 depends on my.company:common-api. I want to generate aggregated Javadocs that include api-1 and common-api, starting my build from api-1. Since common-api depends on a bunch of other dependencies, these are downloaded. Funny thing is, the Javadocs only include api-1 and common-api as per my dependencySourceInclude. But then why does it need to download so many dependencies?

Hope this explanation is helpful.
@JohnCasey Although I only want to include the drools dependency's javadoc-resources, it's also downloading those of slf4j, springframework, etc. Any way to stop that?

This issue has been auto closed because it has been inactive for a long period of time. If you think this issue still applies, retest your problem with the most recent version of Maven and the affected component, reopen and post your results.

The issue is still there (using maven-javadoc-plugin:3.0.1) with includeDependencySources = true and includeTransitiveDependencySources = false :

<build>
    <plugins>
        <plugin>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
            <executions>
                <execution>
                    <id>aggregate-javadoc</id>
                    <goals>
                        <goal>jar</goal>
                    </goals>
                    <configuration>
                        <outputDirectory>target/apidocs</outputDirectory>
                        <attach>true</attach>
                        <debug>true</debug>
                        <verbose>true</verbose>
                        <includeDependencySources>true</includeDependencySources>
                        <includeTransitiveDependencySources>false</includeTransitiveDependencySources>
                        <stylesheetfile>${basedir}/src/main/javadoc/javadoc_stylesheet.css</stylesheetfile>
                        <detectOfflineLinks>false</detectOfflineLinks>
                        <links>
                            <link>http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/</link>
                        </links>
                        <excludePackageNames>.internal:.config</excludePackageNames>
                        <sourceFileExcludes>
                            <exclude>com/company/core/Check*.java</exclude>
                        </sourceFileExcludes>
                    </configuration>
                </execution>
            </executions>
        </plugin>
    </plugins>
</build>
<dependencies>
    <!-- framework -->
    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.company</groupId>
        <artifactId>fwk-library-1</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.company</groupId>
        <artifactId>fwk-library-2</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <!-- test materials -->
    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.company</groupId>
        <artifactId>fwk-commons</artifactId>
        <type>test-jar</type>
    </dependency>
</dependencies>

 

Which results in a veeery long list of `javadoc-resources.jar` download attempts:

[INFO] --- maven-javadoc-plugin:3.0.1:jar (aggregate-javadoc) @ im-javadoc ---                                                                                                                                 
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/apache/activemq/activemq-openwire-legacy/5.15.7/activemq-openwire-legacy-5.15.7-javadoc-resources.jar

Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/aspectj/aspectjrt/1.8.9/aspectjrt-1.8.9-javadoc-resources.jar                                                                  
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-server/9.4.11.v20180605/jetty-server-9.4.11.v20180605-javadoc-resources.jar                                
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/javax/servlet/javax.servlet-api/3.1.0/javax.servlet-api-3.1.0-javadoc-resources.jar                                                
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-http/9.4.11.v20180605/jetty-http-9.4.11.v20180605-javadoc-resources.jar                                    
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-io/9.4.11.v20180605/jetty-io-9.4.11.v20180605-javadoc-resources.jar                                        
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-webapp/9.4.11.v20180605/jetty-webapp-9.4.11.v20180605-javadoc-resources.jar                                
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-xml/9.4.11.v20180605/jetty-xml-9.4.11.v20180605-javadoc-resources.jar                                      
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-util/9.4.11.v20180605/jetty-util-9.4.11.v20180605-javadoc-resources.jar                                    
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-servlet/9.4.11.v20180605/jetty-servlet-9.4.11.v20180605-javadoc-resources.jar                              
Downloading: http://vbet0008g.gre.hpecorp.net:8080/nexus/content/groups/public/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-security/9.4.11.v20180605/jetty-security-9.4.11.v20180605-javadoc-resources.jar
[...]

 

This process can take almost one hour ....

Build succeeded in Jenkins: Maven TLP » maven-javadoc-plugin » MJAVADOC-338 #2

See https://builds.apache.org/job/maven-box/job/maven-javadoc-plugin/job/MJAVADOC-338/2/

Build succeeded in Jenkins: Maven TLP » maven-javadoc-plugin » master #2

See https://builds.apache.org/job/maven-box/job/maven-javadoc-plugin/job/master/2/
This project has moved from Jira to GitHub Issues. This issue was migrated to apache/maven-javadoc-plugin#638.
